t: Psalm 35
Prayer for Victory
Of David.
Oppose*pn my opponents, Lord;*s fight*ln those who fight me.
Take*ln your shields — large and small — and*ln come to my aid.
Draw*ln the spear and javelin against my pursuers, and*ln assure me, “I am your deliverance.”
Let*pn those who intend to take my life be*ln disgraced and humiliated; let*ln those who plan to harm me be*ln turned back and ashamed.
Let*ln them be like chaff in the wind, with*ln the angel of the Lord*s driving them away.
Let*ln their way be dark and slippery, with*ln the angel of the Lord*s pursuing them.
They*ln hid their net for me without cause; they*ln dug a pit for me without cause.
Let*ln ruin come on him unexpectedly, and*ln let the net that he hid ensnare him; let*ln him fall into it — to his ruin.
Then*pn I will rejoice in the Lord;*s I*ln will delight in his deliverance.
All*ln my bones will say, “Lord,*sln who is like you, rescuing*ln the poor from one too strong for him, the*ln poor or the needy from one who robs him?”
Malicious*pn witnesses come forward; they*ln question me about things I do not know.
They*ln repay me evil for good, making*ln me desolate.
Yet*ln when they were sick, my*ln clothing was sackcloth; I*ln humbled myself with fasting, and*ln my prayer was genuine.
I*ln went about mourning as if for my friend or brother; I*ln was bowed down with grief, like*ln one mourning for a mother.
But*ln when I stumbled, they gathered in glee; they*ln gathered against me. Assailants*ln I did not know tore*ln at me and did not stop.
With*ln godless mockery they*ln gnashed their teeth at me.
Lord,*pn how long will you look on? Rescue*ln me from their ravages; rescue*ln my precious life from the young lions.
I*ln will praise you in the great assembly; I*ln will exalt you among many people.
Do*ln not let my deceitful enemies rejoice over me; do*ln not let those who hate me without cause wink*ln at me maliciously.
For*ln they do not speak in friendly ways, but*ln contrive fraudulent schemes against*ln those who live peacefully in the land.
They*ln open their mouths wide against me and say, “Aha,*ln aha! We saw it!”
You*pn saw it, Lord;*s do not be silent. Lord,*ln do not be far from me.
Wake*ln up and rise to my defense, to*ln my cause, my God and my Lord!
Vindicate*ln me, Lord*s my God, in*ln keeping with your righteousness, and*ln do not let them rejoice over me.
Do*ln not let them say in their hearts, “Aha!*ln Just what we wanted.” Do*ln not let them say, “We*ln have swallowed him up!”
Let*ln those who rejoice at my misfortune be*ln disgraced and humiliated; let*ln those who exalt themselves over me be*ln clothed with shame and reproach.
Let*pn those who want my vindication shout*ln for joy and be glad; let*ln them continually say, “The*ln Lord*s be exalted. He*ln takes pleasure in his servant’s well-being.”
And*ln my tongue will proclaim your righteousness, your*ln praise all day long.
